Info Source: Contained in data received from the agency on February 25, 2021 in response to an open records request. The data -- which in some cases merged penalty amounts from multiple violations --was a spreadsheet version of information contained in individual case documents that can be retrieved at https://www.ahs.dep.pa.gov/eFACTSWeb/default.aspx

Description: TRW Deutschland Holding GmbH, a Koblenz, Germany-based subsidiary of U.S.-based TRW Automotive Holdings Corp., agreed to plead guilty for its involvement in a conspiracy to fix prices of seatbelts, airbags and steering wheels sold to two German automobile manufacturers, and installed in cars sold in the United States. It agreed to pay a $5.1 million criminal fine and to cooperate with the department's ongoing investigation.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/german-subsidiary-trw-automotive-agrees-plead-guilty-price-fixing-automobile-parts-installed

Description: TRW Vehicle Safety Systems Inc. agreed to plead guilty to federal and state criminal charges relating to the illegal handling of hazardous wastes.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2001/January/027enrd.htm

Private Litigation Case Title: Jobe, et al v. TRW Automotive US
Info Source: The settlement amount, which includes $660,000 in legal fees, was reported by BNA's Employment Discrimination Report (August 6, 2003).

Description: TRW Vehicle Safety Systems Inc. agreed to $8.8 million to Arizona in settlement of allegations it illegally disposed of the chemical sodium azide, a hazardous, volatile, powder-like substance that is used to explode air bags on impact. This was part of a larger $17.6 million settlement that also involved the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/az-trw-vehicle-safety-systems-inc
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20030422042449/http://www.attorney_general.state.az.us/press_releases/jan/011801.html

Description: ZF agreed to pay $183,750 to the attorneys general of California and Florida to resolve allegations that its subsidiary TRW conspired with other parts manufacturers to rig bids for, fix and maintain the price of systems installed in cars purchased by state agencies.
Info Source: http://app3.naag.org/antitrust/search/viewCivilLitigation.php?trans_id=728
Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/28/2020.
Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/28/2020.

Description: Illegal storage & disposal of sodium azide.
Info Source: Contained in data received from the agency on November 10, 2020 in response to an open records request.

Description: TRW Automotive agreed to pay $30.2 million to resolve an ERISA class action.
Private Litigation Case Title: INTERNATIONAL UNION, UNITED AUTOMOBILE, AEROSPACE AND AGRICULTURAL IMPLEMENT WORKERS OF AMERICA (UAW) et al v. TRW Inc.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1301458/trw-to-pay-30-2m-to-end-auto-steel-workers-benefit-row
